title: Doncaster Circular Walk Route

images.title: Steve F, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Doncaster bypass crossing the River Don.

images.title: Dave Bevis / Doncaster - Don Footbridge & View to Newton
images.caption: Doncaster river view.

images.title: Michael Patterson / Edlington Wood
images.caption: Edlington Wood. This footpath leads into Edlington Wood.

images.title: Main Street in Wadworth by Jonathan Clitheroe, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Main Street in Wadworth. Notable historic buildings in the village include the Grade I listed Wadworth Hall and the parish church of St John the Baptist.

images.title: Bridleway towards New Rossington by JThomas, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bridleway towards New Rossington. The area known as "Rossington" is made up of a number of villages and hamlets, namely "Hesley", "Littleworth", "Rossington", "New Rossington", Rossington Bridge and Shooters Hill.

images.title: Auckley Green by Richard Croft, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Auckley Green in spring with daffodils. The village is located about five miles east of Doncaster city centre

images.title: Michael Patterson / Torne at Auckley
images.caption: Torne at Auckley. The River Torne passes beneath Main Street in Auckley. A footpath follows the river to its bridge with the A614.

description: This is a circular walk through the countryside and woodland around the Yorkshire town of Doncaster. The Doncastrian Way walk includes lovely waterside stretches along the River Don and the River Torne, while there are also pleasant woodland sections through Edlington and Wadworth Wood. The path passes the villages of Wadworth, New Rossington and Auckley. For a shorter route try our Doncaster River Walk which runs from Doncaster to Conisbrough along the Don. Here you can visit the impressive Conisbrough Viaduct and enjoy fine views from the top of structure. There's also the picturesque weirs at Sprotbrough Falls to enjoy in this area. The walk forms part of the Don Valley Way, a long distance route which can be followed all the way to Sheffield.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: You could enjoy a pit stop in Wadworth at The White Hart. Its a traditional family run pub serving high quality home cooked food daily. All their produce and products are sourced from local butchers and greengrocers. You can find them on the Main Street at postcode DN11 9AZ. They are dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: For more walking ideas in the area see the Yorkshire Walks page.

display_address: York Road, Cusworth, Doncaster, South Yorkshire, England, DN5 8AD, United Kingdom
